text: it's online only grocery retailer so we
don't have any shops we pick and pack
our customers orders in huge automated
warehouses before shipping them there to
their kitchen tables in one-hour slots
and we build all the technology that
does that in-house I think it's really
difficult to learn to swim without
getting your feet wet there's still far
too much talk about digital
transformation rather than actually just
doing it at scale and my suggestion
would be you need to find a club crowd
for a strategy that works for you
because clearly it's not a one size fits
all so there are a number of reasons why
we decided to move to the cloud
the first was that we wanted greater
agility for our engineers we wanted to
be able to experiment faster we want
them to be able to deploy into
production faster but also we wanted to
have access to Best of Breed middleware
and services that some of which you just
simply cannot run on premise but then
another need came up which is we when we
embarked on building the Accardo smart
platform which is making our technology
available to large bricks and mortar
retailers around the world we wanted
that to be cloud first from day one we
didn't want to be building data centers
around the world we wanted to focus on
the areas where we could truly add value
and that really just cemented our
decision to move to the cloud
we chose AWS as a cloud provider not
only because of the extraordinary range
of services that it could offer us but
also because of the support that they
were able to provide in helping our
engineers get up speed on those services
[Music]
we collect a huge amount of data across
a platform and that allows us to train
the machine learning that really infects
almost every part of our platform right
from the e-commerce side where what we
want our customers to be able to shop
with less friction and greater delight
forecasting all the orders that go for
the 50,000 different items that we sell
controlling our warehouses in real time
routing our fans it rip there are so
many applications of AI across our
platform so before moving to the cloud
our engineers would regularly complain
about how long it took to provision new
environments new databases and also they
wanted to be able to run experiments
before we even knew whether we would
want the infrastructure to stand it up
long term and now we find that our
engineers can go from conceiving of a
basic service to having it deployed in
production in under an hour they also
tell us that there have been at least 20
times over the project of building and
the Accardo smart platform where they've
because they've found that they really
needed something in terms of a cloud
service on the AWS platform but before
they'd even had to ask for it it'd have
appeared which is fantastic
[Music]
in terms of the services we use I think
there's probably about 28 of them at the
moment that we use heavily we use Amazon
VPC to create the environments for each
retailer on the Accardo smart platform
we use elastic Beanstalk to orchestrate
ec2 instances we use elastic load
balancer to maintain those services in
hae across multiple from all four
availability zones we use elastic search
for logs who are starting to use
services such as lambda which were very
excited about in terms of service
compute I think for what's really
exciting about lambda is it solves a
problem of what you do with those
services that you need intermittently or
that you want to be event-driven and
rather than spinning up instances which
are live all the time you know just
waiting for things to happen this
event-driven architecture is makes much
better sense for in terms of cost
[Music]
as an online retailer security is a
topic we've always had to take very
seriously but the fact is that the
external threat landscape is continuing
to evolve and we're never going to be
able to spend as much money on security
as a company such as AWS can and
therefore we want to buy into that
goodness so that we can focus on those
aspects of application security which
are local to us AWS has been a really
great cloud partner for us not only in
terms of the range of certain quality of
services that is offered us but also in
terms of the support it is provided in
helping us build the compute side of our
Cardiff smart platform
